intro: Oligactis cusalaguensis, commonly known as the Guiana shield fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, anchoring itself to tree trunks or branches in the canopy. Its leaves are usually light green and have a soft, velvety texture. Oligactis cusalaguensis plays a vital role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
